definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: They have Japanese lessons every other day.
sentences.chinese: 他们每隔一天上一次日语课。

sentences.english: Could we have a Japanese-speaking guide?
sentences.chinese: 我想要一名会日语的指导。

sentences.english: Japanese lesson on the two days.
Wang has released 10 Mandarin and two Japanese albums.
sentences.chinese: 王力宏发行了10张国语和2张日语专辑。

sentences.english: This paper studies the evaluative meanings of Japanese toritate-particles.
sentences.chinese: 本文考察日语提示助词表达的评价性意义。

sentences.english: The verb of the Japanese given relation is very complicated.
sentences.chinese: 日语授受关系的动词用法很复杂。

sentences.english: By using the honorifics in Japanese, you can easily get closer with people in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 通过日语中的敬语，在谈话中你能和人进一步的接近。

sentences.english: By the time I left that school I had learned Japanese for two years.
sentences.chinese: 到我离开那所学校时，我已经学了两年日语了。

sentences.english: Japanese majors have more free active vocabulary than the non-language majors do.
sentences.chinese: 日语学生比非语言专业学生的自由主动词汇更多。

sentences.english: He could speak Chinese English and also Japnese.
sentences.chinese: 他会说汉语英语和日语。

sentences.english: Does he learn Japanese or French?
Starting from today, we'll study Japanese in a spare time school for workers.
sentences.chinese: 从今天起，我们要在工人业余学校学日语。

sentences.english: The interview has been translated from Japanese and edited.
sentences.chinese: 采访用日语进行，以下是经过编辑的访谈内容。
“五日元”在日语里谐音“有缘份”。

sentences.english: In our junior year, Natalie and I shared a Japanese class.
sentences.chinese: 在高中三年，娜塔莉和我一起上日语课。

sentences.english: We'd like a Japanese-speaking guide, please.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要一个日语导游。

definition: Korean language (esp. in context of South Korea)
